website_summaries.verdict: A top-performing, versatile security key by a trusted name in the industry. If you are looking for the best protection available, the YubiKey 5 Nano is the one to buy.
pros: Works with numerous apps, protocols, and popular online platforms for optimal security
Can be left in your computer, and doesn't stick out significantly from the USB slot like some other models
cons: It's very small and easy to lose
A few faulty keys have been reported
Price falls on the high end of the scale

customer_reviews.title: Extremely convoluted setup/installation
customer_reviews.text: Setup is too convoluted, to the point of not usable. I can see it works with enterprise users with IT support. Not for average user, not for above-average users. We also purchased the Google's Titan, it is much more user-friendly. Also, the nano comes without the string shown on the picture, so it is too tiny to handle and too easy to lose. Attach some string before you try to mess with it. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: readersread

customer_reviews.title: A Premature hardware product still wating for software support
customer_reviews.text: Workable somehow under Linux. Can't work under Windows 10 version 1809, despite Bill gates had promised us that Windows 10 version 1809 will support FIDO2.
customer_reviews.author: Pecci

customer_reviews.title: Need two Yubikey 5's to be safe and impossible to install.
customer_reviews.text: Windows Hello software is not yet implemented. The installation is extremely difficult and requires downloading much additional software. Very counter intuitive. The instructions say that you must have two of the keys to be safe. I have not yet been able to get it to work and will abandon my attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Truitt

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: Plug it into a USB slot on your PC and touch with finger to activate when using 2nd factor authentication on sites that require or accept Yubi key 2fa. Worked on .gov site and bitcoin wallet site. Works fine with Windows 7. When you're activating it a green light turns on. It is really tiny so used regular size paperclip to get out of USB slot, there is a little hole you can slide the paperclip through then pull it out. Can leave permanently inserted in computer, will only be activated when you touch it. Been using for several months easy and no problems. Does what it should.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Good for very limited applications
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea, but the list of applications, at least for non-developers, is extremely limited. The use case for it also doesn’t really blend well with the average user. If you are a software developer and use multiple devices, this may work really well for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yubikey 5 does not have CCID, will not work with your Windows 10 login
customer_reviews.text: This one can only work with the account that can issue CA cert, such as Microsoft login. But it will never work with any Win10 login because Windows 10 itself cannot issue any CA cert. Anyone dreams of Password-less Win10 login need a CCID based yubikey, NOT this one. Although passcode based login still works with yubikey 5, such as Win7 login, Linux login. If you are thinking about using this with Win10, I would recommend you better save your $50 now.
customer_reviews.author: djs

customer_reviews.title: 2nd version of this, still love it
customer_reviews.text: I have 1 of these for each of my laptops, and love them. They're extremely low profile, and make proper security much simpler. If you don't know they're there, they're basically invisible. They don't stick out enough to snag on anything, and they work perfectly with LastPass and other two factor needs.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Must have for today’s security
customer_reviews.text: After having my computer hacked and the hacker trying to get into my back account, credit cards, and PayPal I looked for a better solution for security. There is nothing that I know of that is better and more secure then this little device. Granted it takes some extra work to set up and use but if you want to sleep peacefully at night knowing everything is locked down then this is a must have item. With hackers getting bolder and more aggressive these days it’s a no brainer. It’s like they old saying you can pay me now or later. It’s not if you’ll be hacked it’s when. I just wish it was cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Merenkov

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but with caveats
customer_reviews.text: First Yubikey does do exactly what it promises and makes certain software and web services far more secure. But there are three caveats: First, you really do have to buy a second one of these (any model 5 version will do). If you have only one and something goes wrong, you are permanently locked out of whatever you sought to protect. Second, there is a steep learning curve here. Forget about Yubi's obtuse instructions. Go to YouTube and watch some videos on Yubikeys. Third, as of yet there are not that many online services that you can protect with 2FA. But more are coming, so get ready.
customer_reviews.author: C. C. Kissinger

customer_reviews.title: Yubikeys are AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Yubikey, after the Neo and 4. All three of them are still working perfectly. I use these for 2FA for services like Google, and as my private key for SSHing into servers.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Milum Jr

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars - Makes me feel more secure already
customer_reviews.text: 5 Stars - makes me feel more secure already. Bought two different ones, one for the iPhone and this one. They are really easy to setup but I'm good with computers. I wish all online retailers would let me use this type of hard keyed MFA. Will be writing letters to all of them to add compatibility. I checked with the most important vendors first to see if it was compatible with this MFA key and LastPass. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: American DD

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These keys did everything they're supposed to do. They are fast, sure and easy to use. I even ordered a third permanent key for my PC after I got the other two. I'll be using these for a long time, I think it will be awhile before something better comes along.
customer_reviews.author: James Riggle

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality, not practically portable
customer_reviews.text: Expensive and nearly impossible to carry or put on a keychain. If you plan to leave it plugged into one PC, it will work great. Because it can’t be easily attached to a keychain or lanyard, it is not portable
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great added security
customer_reviews.text: The best when it comes to use and security of your computer. I couldn't figure out how to rate the 'warmth' category. What is that?
customer_reviews.author: hb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and adds a layer of security.
customer_reviews.text: I’m sort of a security freak. Having this makes me feel safe. It is super easy to use and does add another layer of security.
customer_reviews.author: PAS182

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Does not work, whatsoever, on any platform. Complete waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: If you don't have a security Key, you are failing already.
customer_reviews.text: This is low profile so it fits a couple of my more mobile surface laptops and that is good.
customer_reviews.author: Razor Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I love Yubikey
customer_reviews.text: These devices are fantastic for MFA. I have used these products for years and have had great success with them across multiple industries. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AxlF

customer_reviews.title: Be careful or you'll ruin your USB port
customer_reviews.text: you have to be careful with this, it's so easy to get it stuck in your computer, and they do not give you any kind of cord to put through the loop to get it out.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, easy configuration.
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a yubikey for a while and finally purchased this one. I love how easy it was to configure and the small size is perfect. I hardly even notice it. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: Tightened up all my online services with this. Don't forget to take advantage of static mode in slot 2. A must if you use an online password manager.
customer_reviews.author: Primelap

customer_reviews.title: Excellent multi factor protection!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third yubikey and I am very happy to add this to my PC as a leave in solution for an excellent multifactor solution
customer_reviews.author: Logan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Secure and robust.
customer_reviews.text: Compact size, works with almost every login or password manager and most websites.
customer_reviews.author: Wheres.Waldo

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: just plug & play. small con: if you press it by accident while inside your laptop it will type gibberish to wherever page you're on.
customer_reviews.author: Roni. R

customer_reviews.title: Works Well With Mac
customer_reviews.text: All I did was plug it in and added to Dashlane and it works the same as the Nano 4
customer_reviews.author: RandomK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of Yubikeys recently, and I've been very pleased - they're extremely easy to use if you have a bit of technical know-how, and honestly, the only drawback is that it's not supported by enough services.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to up your security game.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and works great. It can be hard to remove from the USB port so I suggest getting a lanyard to make it easier on you. Great for those trying to be more secure online. I highly recommend using it with a password manager to further protect your info.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Require to do extra configuration on Linux. But when it is done works great.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin Labun

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought three and using them on Windows 7 (2 desktops and 1 laptop). They work all the time with no problems. I really appreciate the convenience. Wish they weren't so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: G Johntz

customer_reviews.title: The best for a laptop.
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have one get one for your laptop. You won't regret it one bit. Keep your stuff safe and secure with this key. They are easy to use and so helpful. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Skysg

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to be secure
customer_reviews.text: I have a USB-A and USB-C version of the YubiKey Nano 5, and they are both fantastic. It is SO easy to use! It does take a few minutes of setup to get it configured to work with your specific accounts, but once it is working logging in is as easy as touching the Yubikey. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Collin T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for people that know what they're doing
customer_reviews.text: I own a Yubikey 5 Nano and a Yubikey 5 NFC. Why two? Because you need two to have a backup. This is recommended practice by Yubico, if one is willing to dig deep enough through their documentation to find it. These devices have a lot of functions that most people won't know how to use. Most people could make heavy use of the OATH-TOTP(Google Authenticator replacement) and the FIDO/WebAuthn/U2F ("Security Key") functions, since these are widely deployed with popular service providers. The Google Titan can't do OATH-TOTP, so it can't be your only second factor device. These devices can, and they'd be more widely used, if the documentation was a little more friendly.
customer_reviews.author: dan314159

customer_reviews.title: The YubiKey 5 Nano is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible. I have the Yubico YubiKey 5 Nano, which stays in the USB. Every time you touch it by accident it will spit out a long sequence of long characters to your browser or to your Office document. So I have a bunch of these long characters in Excel or Word that looks like junk or typo. They really needed a REAL button versus the metal contact that triggers the long character string.vvcccckefrrkrhrllhrvicnburhlivhdhcrrbreienhf See? Just touch it by accident. vvcccckefrrkngvjelhggd this thing is going into the rectangular bin...
customer_reviews.author: Tat Huen

customer_reviews.title: Don't listen to the haters. This is an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised to see so many negative reviews. I'm about to buy another batch of them (the usb-a nano version, in particular). The thing just works; at least it works with Chrome and ChromeOS. That you cannot transfer the configuration from one computer to another is a FEATURE, not a bug! It means they've done their hardware right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, easy to use. The only thing is its a bit tricky to remove from computer.
customer_reviews.author: Stefna

product_meta.title: Yubico YubiKey 5 Nano - Two Factor Authentication USB Security Key, Fits USB-A Ports - Protect Your Online Accounts with More Than a Password, FIDO Certified USB Password Key, Extra Compact Size
feature_bullets: SECURITY KEY: Protect your online accounts against unauthorized access by using 2 factor authentication with the Yubico YubiKey 5 Nano security key - the world's most protective USB security key that works with more online services/apps than any other.

FIDO: The YubiKey 5 Nano is FIDO certified and works with Google Chrome and any FIDO-compliant application on Windows, Mac OS or Linux. Secure your login and protect your Gmail, Facebook, Dropbox, Outlook, LastPass, Dashlane accounts, 1Password, and more.

FITS USB-A PORTS: Once registered, each service will request you to insert the YubiKey PC security key into a USB-A port and simply tap to gain access. The extra compact size is designed to stay in the port so you can stay connected and secure anywhere.

DURABLE AND SECURE: Extremely secure and durable, YubiKeys are tamper resistant, water resistant, and crush resistant. The YubiKey 5 Nano is designed to protect your online accounts from phishing and account takeovers. Proudly made in the USA.

MULTI-PROTOCOL SUPPORT: The YubiKey USB authenticator has multi-protocol support including FIDO2, FIDO U2F, Yubico OTP, OATH-TOTP, OATH-HOTP, Smart card (PIV), OpenPGP, and Challenge-Response capability to give you strong hardware-based authentication.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars163 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
